title: Garlic and Onion Harvest -  Cold Climate Gardening

tasks.task: Gardening tasks involving onion and garlic harvesting, storage, and curing.
subtasks: Pulling and removing onions from containers.
Storing onions in a garden wagon for drying and curing.
Gently removing garlic from the soil.
Using a tool (hori hori knife) to extract garlic without damaging roots.
Observing garlic scapes and removing them to promote bulb growth.
Assessing the readiness of garlic for harvest based on leaf coloration.
Storing harvested garlic in a cool, well-ventilated area in the basement.
Preparing onions and garlic for storage by cutting back tops and roots.
Discussing plans for future gardening improvements, such as container garlic cultivation.
Sharing gardening experiences and challenges (e.g., chokecherry suckers, cold weather concerns) in relation to crop cultivation.
